Episode Summary: Episode # 7742 ~ Brooke tells Thorne he must find a different place to live because of his issues about her marriage; anxious about the possible outcome of the paternity test she's taken, Steffy confronts Bill about whether he used her to exact revenge on Liam.
Recap: Steffy looks around to make sure Liam is not around so he can hear. She calls her doctor who says they should know today who the baby's father is. She hugs Liam again when he says she is carrying his child. Katie and Wyatt continue to play games. He arrives as the tool guy plumber and she is the damsel in distress wrapped only in her sexy, skimpy lingerie. He wants to know who else can service her needs. He has been the pizza guy to almost anything else she needs. Brooke tells Thorne to stop teasing her. He says he does only because he likes to see that smile. Justin asks Bill how was his Christmas. Bill says fine especially when the boys came by. Liam talks to the baby via Steffy's tummy and says he is going to work and glad to be doing that. She has a flashback of when Bill told her he would get his revenge on Liam. She goes to Bill's and says sorry they have to meet here but they needed privacy. The baby has to be Liam's but there is the possibility it could be Bill's. She wants him to be honest with her. She asks if her marriage concerns him. He says of course. She wants to know if he slept with her to get revenge on Liam. Brooke tells Thorne they have a problem. She is engaged to Ridge but Thorne does not want her to be. He says he will always be around to help her. Wyatt shows up at the office and grouses to Liam that he left some very important things for this meeting and now Bill is not here and no one knows why. Liam says his dad is going to flip when he finds out he is going to be a granddad.

Bill answers Steffy that no, of course not, he would never hurt Liam like that. All of that was before they made peace. Liam disrespected his marriage and his wife when he put Sally above that so they were there for each other out of love. He truly was loving her and it was never about revenge. She says okay she believes him. They both put themselves in this situation. She remarks that she is going to the doctor. He offers to go with her. She says she will go alone. This is her journey and she will make sure this baby is Liam's. Katie is shocked, so is Throne when she runs to the door and thinks it is Wyatt coming back. She is still in her definitely not visiting attire. She makes an apology and invites him in anyway. Wyatt tells Liam that he sure is lucky to have Steffy and that she gets along so well with Bill and both of them are on Liam's side. In the doctor's office Steffy panics and wants to know if the doctor has the results ..she has to know now and this baby must be Liam's.
Transcript: [ Telephone beeps ]
Dr. Campbell: Yes? Of course. Steffy, good morning.
Steffy: I hope so, dr. Campbell.
Dr. Campbell: Well, I just checked before my last patient, and your results aren't in yet.
Steffy: But you do expect them today?
Dr. Campbell: Yes. How was your holiday?
Steffy: I'm sure you can imagine.
Dr. Campbell: Well, if it's any consolation, we should know the paternity of your child by the end of today.
Steffy: Thank you, doctor. Great.
[ Sighs ]
Bill: Pregnant.
Steffy: Yes.
Bill: You're sure.
Steffy: My doctor confirmed it. It's happy news, bill. Liam and I have wanted this for so long.
Bill: Steffy, there's a possibility that child is mine.
Justin: What? Santa wasn't good to you? Oh. Want to talk about it?
Liam: Hey.
Steffy: Hey, yourself. How was your run?
Liam: It was good. Actually, it was more than good. The weather, the waves, the breeze. Everything is perfect. How could it not be? My beautiful wife is carrying my child.
[ Both chuckle ]
Brooke: Another memorable holiday, wasn't it?
Thorne: Yeah. Christmas at dad's house. Nothing better. Except for a certain announcement.
Brooke: I'm engaged to your brother. Might as well get used to it.
Thorne: Well, that's asking the impossible.
Brooke: Thorne, I've been giving it a lot of thought. I think it's best that you move out of here.
[ Knock on door ]
[ Knock on door ]
Katie: Who is it?
Wyatt: You called about your water heater, ma'am.
Katie: Just a second. I just can't seem to get it hot enough.
Wyatt: Hmm. Yeah, I can help you with that. I should warn you, though, my service fee is high for a morning call.
Katie: [ Laughs ]
Wyatt: Yeah, it's coming off.
[ Cellphone chimes ]
Katie: Mnh, mnh, mnh, mnh, mnh, mnh. No, no, no, no, no. Don't look at it.
Wyatt: Too late. Damn it!
Katie: What?
Wyatt: It's a meeting I have at the office I forgot about.
Katie: Seriously?!
Wyatt: Trust me, I know, okay? I -- [ Sighs ] I will get back here and make sure that water heater is boiling so hot. I'll even waive the service fee. Hmm?
Katie: I wouldn't leave if i were you.
Wyatt: Is that a threat or a promise?
Katie: I'm just saying, i have needs, and if you can't satisfy them, then I'm gonna have to call another plumber.
Wyatt: Oh! What?! Now, who is gonna fulfill your needs the way that I can?
Katie: I don't know, but might be fun finding out.
Wyatt: Why did I push for a free, easy relationship?
Katie: I'm just saying. You're a free agent, I'm a free agent. I'm just waiting for the offers to come rolling in.
Wyatt: From who? The mailman? The pizza delivery guy? I've been those guys! I am those guys!
Katie: Well, I guess you're not gonna find out if you leave me here all by my lonesome. Something to think about, huh?
Wyatt: Oh, my -- you are killing me right now.
Katie: [ Chuckles ]
Wyatt: You are.
Katie: That's the point.
[ Chuckles ]
[ Birds chirping ]
Thorne: Wore out my welcome already.
Brooke: That's not possible, and you know it.
Thorne: You afraid of temptation? Is that it?
Brooke: That's not possible, either.
Thorne: [ Laughs ] Ridge has you wrapped around his little finger that tightly? I don't think so.
Brooke: Thorne forrester, stop teasing me!
Thorne: I only do it because I love seeing that smile. Ultimately, it's your life. It's your choice. I can only provide you with an option. A better one, I might add.
Brooke: [ Sighs ] Yeah. Well, it's time.
Thorne: I know.
Justin: How was christmas?
Bill: Quiet. Me and will for most of the day. Katie and the boys came by later.
Justin: Nice. Family time, the way it should be. Everything okay? You and katie didn't have words or something?
Bill: No.
Justin: Liam and steffy are good?
Bill: Yeah. Yeah, it's all gonna work out. Has to.
Liam: You -- ah! Uh-oh! I think I feel movement.
Steffy: [ Laughs ] Get out of here. It's way too early.
Liam: Yeah?
Steffy: [ Laughing ] Yeah.
Liam: All right, well, if this kid's anything like its father, before too long, you're gonna feel some serious yoga moves.
Steffy: That's not yoga.
Liam: That's --
Steffy: [ Laughs ]
Liam: It's poor man's yoga.
Steffy: I want our baby to be just like you. That's all I'm hoping and praying for.
Liam: Hey.
Steffy: Off to work?
Liam: Yeah. Who'd have thunk, right? 'Cause I'm happy about it. Wasn't too long ago my dad was vowing revenge against me.
Steffy: I don't even want to think about that.
Liam: No, I don't either. You're right. I'm sorry. Hey, team huddle.
Steffy: [ Laughs ]
Liam: Um, nothing but positive thoughts for your mother from here on out. Da! No! No back talk! You listen to your father! He knows what's best! [ Whispers ] I don't know what's best.
Steffy: I love you.
Liam: Love you, too. Phone call away.
Steffy: All right.
[ Door closes ]
Liam: Wasn't too long ago my dad was vowing revenge against me.
Bill: Well, he's gonna pay for this. I will have my revenge.
Steffy: No.
[ Cellphone chirps ]
Justin: Well, listen, it's obvious something's going on with you, dollar bill, okay? I'm not gonna keep asking if you don't want to talk about it. I'm here, okay?
Bill: I got to go.
Justin: What about the meeting that we were --
Bill: Later.
Katie: You are telling me that you would prefer a boring meeting to this?
Wyatt: It's not a matter of prefer.
Katie: You sure about that?
Wyatt: Hmm. Whatever happened to responsibility here, huh?
Katie: Oh, I am responding. I am responding right now.
Wyatt: God, I can't just -- i can't call it off! I set the agenda! It's the year-end report.
Katie: Poor baby.
Wyatt: [ Sighs ]
Katie: Fine. You got a meeting.
Wyatt: Which you're making really hard for me to attend right now.
Katie: It's funny. I'm feeling free for the first time in my life, and you're feeling...
Wyatt: Trapped by my own freedom?
Katie: I think you better go to your meeting.
Wyatt: [ Groans ]
Katie: [ Chuckles ]
Steffy: Sorry to insist we meet here, but this has to be private.
Bill: Did the doctor give you the results of the paternity test?
Steffy: Not yet, but today.
Bill: Are you okay?
Steffy: My future is in a medical lab. Bill, this child has to be liam'S. But, you know, there'S... there's a possibility it could be yours.
Bill: Well, if that's the case, we'll deal with it.
Steffy: Hey, I, uh, I got to ask you something, and I want you to be honest with me. You know you can't lie to me, bill.
Bill: I wouldn't lie to you. Ask me anything. I'll give it to you straight. My only concern is you and the baby.
Steffy: What about my marriage? Does that concern you?
Bill: Of course it does. What's bothering you, steffy?
Steffy: The night at the guesthouse... did you use me? Did you sleep with me to get revenge on liam?
Brooke: I'm gonna miss you, thorne.
Thorne: Oh, I'll be around. I'm not leaving town. Just getting the heave-ho.
Brooke: Oh!
Thorne: [ Chuckles ]
Brooke: I just -- I think it's best for both of us.
Thorne: Both of us?
Brooke: I'm engaged to ridge, and you'd rather I wasn't, so that could be a problem.
Thorne: For you, maybe.
Brooke: Doesn't it bother you seeing me with ridge given the way you feel?
Thorne: No, what bothers me is what you're doing to yourself after everything he's put you through.
Brooke: He has grown. We both have.
Thorne: Well, I'd really like to believe that, for your sake. Look, no matter what happens, I'll be around, and I'll never say I told you so, okay?
Brooke: Okay.
[ Door opens, closes ]
Wyatt: Dad couldn't make it?
Liam: I mean, justin said he just got a text and ran out of the building.
Wyatt: Well, any idea where he went?
Liam: Nope.
Wyatt: Well, I could have canceled this meeting! I was in the middle of some very important things!
Liam: You were in the middle of some very important things? You got somewhere you'd rather be? What's her name?
Wyatt: Oh, come -- seriously?
Liam: What's her name, bro?
Wyatt: That's funny.
Liam: What's her name?
Wyatt: Funny.
Liam: What's her name?
Wyatt: Christmas, you and steffy seemed to be very excited, huh? Expecting and all. Did you happen to tell someone about it?
Liam: No, no, no, no. We're not -- I mean, not until, like, further down the line. We're being cautiously optimistic.
Wyatt: All right, all right. Well, no one will hear it from me.
Liam: It's gonna be fun, though.
Wyatt: Hmm.
Liam: Telling everyone.
Wyatt: Yeah.
Liam: Dad is gonna flip.
Wyatt: Oh, his first grandchild? [ Sighs ] You know, it's hard to imagine him as a grandpa. [ Both laugh ] Right?
Liam: 'Cause he's --
Wyatt: I know!
Liam: I know!
Bill: Revenge? No! Steffy, no!
Steffy: You said it more than once that you were gonna get revenge on your son for what he did to you.
Bill: That was before!
Steffy: Before we slept together.
Bill: No! Before liam and I made peace. Steffy, my god, I would never... that night was about us. Nothing else.
Steffy: Well, you can understand why I'd think that way.

Bill: Why you would think that way. Given my history, yes. Given our history... no. You were in pain that night over liam's involvement with sally. In his darkest hour, he made it about her, not you. He disrespected his marriage. He disrespected his wife. I hated seeing you suffering like that. And in truth... I suppose I was suffering myself over brooke walking out on me. So we were there for each other out of love, not lust. I was loving you. It was never, ever about revenge.
Steffy: I believe you. I believe you. And I'm sorry.
Bill: No, no. You don't have to apologize to me. You don't ever have to apologize to me. I put you in this situation.
Steffy: No, no. We put ourselves in this situation. I just need to know, bill. And I need to know now.
Bill: Where are you going?
Steffy: I'm going to dr. Campbell'S.
Bill: I can drive you.
Steffy: No, bill. This is my journey. And I'm gonna make sure the baby I'm carrying is my husband'S.
[ Door opens, closes ]
[ Knock on door ]
Katie: I had a feeling you would be... back. Oh.
Thorne: Oh!
Katie: [ Chuckles ]
Thorne: Katie, hi.
Katie: Hi. Um, I-I'm sorry. I wasn't -- I wasn't expecting...
Thorne: Me. Obviously. But someone.
Katie: Yeah. How's it going, thorne?
Thorne: Obviously I'm interrupting something.
[ Both laugh ]
Katie: Uh, uh, no, no, it's just me, myself, and I.
Thorne: But not for long. You're expecting a-a guest.
Katie: Well, I don't normally dress like this for a guest.
Thorne: Right. More than a guest. I'm sorry. I should have called. I'll come back another time.
Katie: Don't be silly. Come on in.
Liam: [ High-pitched voice ] Grandpa dollar bill!
Wyatt: Please don't let your kid call him that.
Liam: [ Normal voice ] Are you kidding me? He's probably gonna put it on a t-shirt.
Wyatt: Oh, god, I hope not.
Liam: Hey, steffy might be the one to buy it for him.
Wyatt: Yeah. You know, steffy and dad, they do -- they do get along really well, don't they?
Liam: Oh, yeah, for sure. She's always had a way with him.
Wyatt: One of the few who do.
Liam: Comes in handy when he gets out of line.
Wyatt: Yeah, put her on the case when he acts up.
Liam: Well, I mean, look what happened last time.
Wyatt: Yeah. You know, you are lucky to have her.
Liam: I know. I can't even begin to count the ways.
Wyatt: God, this -- this kid's gonna bring this family even closer together.
Liam: And dad -- dad is gonna spoil that kid rotten.
Wyatt: Oh, yeah.
Liam: It's gonna be fun to watch.
Wyatt: For me, not for you.
Liam: What?
Wyatt: Yeah, you're gonna have to be reminding him all the time who sets the rules and whose kid it is.
[ Laughs ]
Liam: [ Scoffs ]
Wyatt: Yeah.
Liam: [ Chuckles ]
[ Door opens ]
Dr. Campbell: Sorry to keep you waiting.
Steffy: Yeah, the waiting -- the waiting is killing me.
Dr. Campbell: Okay, you got to get ahold of yourself, steffy.
Steffy: No, I-I have so much riding on this, and I know the stress isn't good for the baby, but I'm trying to deal with it, and the stress -- it's stressing me out even more, and I just --
Dr. Campbell: Okay, stop. Just stop. You have to breathe.
Steffy: No, no, no, the only way to relieve this stress is to find out that liam is the father of my baby. So, is that them? Are those the paternity results? Doctor, I need to know!
